intro: Raphanus raphanistrum var. brevistylus, commonly known as the short-styled wild radish, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round or oval seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and often grows in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
